image.altText: A crowd of people stand on the street outside an Optus store

items.synopsis: Optus says it "may take a few hours for all services to recover", with the telco yet to identify the root issue behind today's huge outage.

title.children: Optus services 'gradually' restored as engineers warn of network vulnerabilities — as it happened

image.altText: A sandstone window with yellow "yes" writing and an Optus sign.

items.synopsis: Optus CEO Kelly Bayer Rosmarin says "a technical network fault" is to blame for the company's nationwide outage on Wednesday, but can't provide more information on the cause before conducting a deeper analysis.

title.children: Optus defends 'front-footed' communication with customers after 'technical network fault'

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a blazer stands in front of greenery.

items.synopsis: A year after a cyber attack exposed the personal details of millions of Optus customers, the telco boss is on another apology tour. She seems to have learned nothing, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: Can Optus boss Kelly Bayer Rosmarin survive another debacle?

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

items.synopsis: Officials at the Australian Antarctic Division were left scrambling after a decision to block RSV Nuyina from transiting the Tasman Bridge and refuelling close to port, with the true cost of a 660km detour now revealed.

title.children: What should have been a 4km refuelling trip for Australia's icebreaker is now a 660km debacle

image.altText: An inflatable pool with a blow up ring floating in it

items.synopsis: A Perth woman who held the heads of both her young children underwater in an inflatable pool is jailed, and banned from ever contacting them again.

title.children: Perth mother jailed after holding children's heads underwater in blow-up pool

image.altText: A close up shot of crocodile teeth, with brown stains on them

items.synopsis: Northern Territory cattle producer Colin Deveraux knows he is lucky to be alive after being attacked by a 3.2-metre saltwater crocodile.

title.children: 'He shook me like a rag doll': Cattleman survives croc attack by biting back

image.altText: Aerial view of Boigu community surrounded by the ocean to the top, green vegetation and water holes below

items.synopsis: Legal and climate experts liken rising sea levels and climate harms to “colonisation” as proceedings for the Australian Climate Case resume.

title.children: Further climate change inaction 'cultural genocide' for Torres Strait, experts say

image.altText: A group of young and middle-aged women cheer and clap in a crowded room.

items.synopsis: Democrats win control of both legislative chambers in Virginia, while in deep-red Kentucky, Democratic governor Andy Beshear is re-elected to a second four-year term.

title.children: Ohio voters enshrine right to abortion in state constitution, Democrats score wins across other US states

image.altText: Men stand watching olives being poured off the back of a truckinto a metal container

items.synopsis: The high prices, driven in part by two years of drought in Spain, mean more opportunity for criminals across the Mediterranean targeting trees centuries old.

title.children: Warehouse break-ins and chainsaw-wielding thieves — here's what surging olive oil prices mean for Mediterranean farmers

image.altText: Composite image of two young men, with police behind them.

items.synopsis: A man who lit bushfires and filmed videos pledging his loyalty to Islamic State is found guilty of terrorism-related offences, but his older brother will walk free after being cleared by a jury.

title.children: Jury delivers mixed verdicts to Melbourne brothers accused of terrorism over small bushfires

image.altText: A large white sign showing a coat of arms and the words "local court".

items.synopsis: The coroner investigating the "scourge" of domestic violence in the Northern Territory has warned there will be "more inquests" if the system does not change.

title.children: 'Rigid masculinity' at the core of domestic violence crisis in Australia, NT coroner hears

image.altText: Malcolm Turnbull at the National Press Club

items.synopsis: The federal government should not be afraid to reassess its signature housing policy, if it is not helping to address the housing crisis in two years' time, Malcolm and Lucy Turnbull tell the National Press Club.

title.children: Turnbulls tell National Press Club to give Albanese's housing fund two years

image.altText: CCTV vision of two police officers standing next to a man on the ground.

items.synopsis: South Australian police release CCTV footage showing part of an incident that resulted in two officers being removed from operational duty while their conduct is investigated.

title.children: SA Police release vision of arrest after officers used taser, pepper spray at care home

image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

items.synopsis: Police have interviewed the driver at the centre of a tragic crash that killed five people in the regional Victorian town of Daylesford, but no charges have been laid.

title.children: Lawyer for Daylesford crash driver says ‘family man’ is deeply distressed and remains in hospital care

image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

items.synopsis: Canada, Japan, and the United States are among the countries that expect service providers to implement roaming capabilities to cover major network failures.

title.children: Why can't customers be automatically switched to other carriers when their network goes down?

image.altText: High Court of Australia

items.synopsis: The High Court rules a Rohingya man has been unlawfully detained in immigration detention, paving the way to end indefinite detention for other asylum seekers.

title.children: High Court ruling paves way to end indefinite detention for asylum seekers with nowhere to go

image.altText: Muslim woman wearing a white hijab, red shirt and black jacket, sitting in her home.

items.synopsis: Hanaa Elmobayed was one of 19 Australians who made it out of Gaza through the Rafah crossing with Egypt last weekend. But there were many times the mother of five feared she'd never make it back to her family.

title.children: Hanaa was visiting her mum in Gaza when the war broke out. Now home, she's scarred from what she saw

image.altText: A headshot of a woman with dark rimmed glasses

items.synopsis: Rhonda O'Sign previously pleaded guilty to stealing from Little Athletics Tasmania's fundraising account to go shopping. She also admitted she rigged a raffle to win a Thermomix food processor.

title.children: Woman who rigged raffles, stole charity money raised by Little Athletics kids avoids jail

image.altText: A composite picture of Glenn Maxwell

items.synopsis: Glenn Maxwell's stunning match-winning double century at the Cricket World Cup has been hailed as the greatest ODI innings of all time. Here are the performances he's up against for that title.

title.children: Glenn Maxwell's innings is 'without a doubt' the best of all time — these are the performances it beats

image.altText: Silverwater jail

items.synopsis: Corrective Services NSW has turned off three websites, including two news sites, as prisoners use a function on their tablets to search inmates' crimes and carry out violence.

title.children: 'Spate of violence': Prisoners use 'loophole' to search news articles about each others' crimes

image.altText: a group of annoyed people surrounding a staff member

items.synopsis: Optus suffered one of the largest telecommunications outages in Australian history today. Here are the factors that can cause such events.

title.children: The Optus outage was one of the largest in Australia's history — so what went wrong?

image.altText: A sign saying "caution" in front of an open pit coal mine and power station.

items.synopsis: The gap between climate rhetoric and fossil fuel use is growing, according to a UN report that warns the world's carbon budget has almost been used up.

title.children: Climate disconnect grows wider as fossil fuel use soars to 'double' required level by 2030

image.altText: People taking photos of Uluru

items.synopsis: Businesses say cost-of-living pressures, expensive airfares and concerns around crime are contributing to a slump in tourism in Central Australia, where the drive market in particular is lagging.

title.children: Central Australia sees 'massive drop' in visitor numbers, as new minister flags revitalisation plan

image.altText: Flowers tied to a guard rail. A police vehicle is parked nearby.

items.synopsis: The NSW Supreme Court hears that a man accused of the murder of a rough sleeper in 2019 fantasised about killing people since he was a child.

title.children: Alleged 'Hand of Death' killer waited for people 'no-one would miss', court hears

image.altText: A young person's hand reaches out to use a computer.

items.synopsis: An IT engineer who worked in schools across Perth is jailed for making indecent recordings of students and downloading thousands of videos and images of children at school activities.

title.children: IT engineer who worked in WA schools jailed for making indecent recordings of students

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

items.synopsis: A trial is underway in the South Australian District Court for a former husband and wife who allegedly had sex with their underage employee who worked at their family-owned bakery in regional SA in the 80s.

title.children: Former couple accused of having sex with underage employee at bakery in regional SA

image.altText: A horse-like head emerges in gas and dust from a region of space 1,375 light-years from Earth

items.synopsis: The European Space Agency wows with the first full colour images from the Euclid space telescope, a "dark matter detective" with the specs to rival the famed James Webb.

title.children: 'Revolution for astronomy': New space telescope captures mind-blowing images of distant galaxies

image.altText: Boris Johnson grimaces while sitting behind a Union Jack flag

items.synopsis: The former UK prime minister's senior advisor says Mr Johnson hoped to show the public COVID-19 did not pose a threat in the early days of the nation's outbreak.

title.children: Former aide says Boris Johnson wanted to be injected with COVID-19 on live TV

image.altText: Man with no hair.

items.synopsis: The verdict comes after the four-week trial of a man who drove an alleged gunman to and from the home of a Newcastle woman shot dead at her front door.

title.children: Jury finds getaway driver guilty of manslaughter, not murder, over grandmother's slaying

image.altText: Donna Simpson, Josh Cunningham and Vikki Thorn sitting on seats in back garden

items.synopsis: Some fans of an Aussie folk rock band will have to wait a little longer to see them in concert as vocalist Donna Simpson recovers from an e-scooter crash.

title.children: The Waifs push back concert after singer suffers collapsed lung in e-scooter fall

image.altText: A close-up photograph of a burgundy-coloured flying duck orchid

items.synopsis: An amateur photographer has been looking across two states for almost a decade for a small orchid resembling a flying duck. Then a tip from a friend finally ended his long search.

title.children: Nine-year 'duck' hunt ends as photographer snaps elusive orchid
